content.question: Part C The function <math> <semantics> <mi>M</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGnbaaaa@39CE@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a linear transformation of vectors defined by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>M</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo stretchy="true">→</mo> </mover> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>B</mi><mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40B0@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, where <math> <semantics> <mover accent="true"> <mi>v</mi> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWG2bGbaSaaaaa@3A09@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is a column vector and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>[</mo> <mrow> <mtable> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mn>2</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mn>2</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mn>2</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mrow> <mo>−</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <msqrt> <mn>2</mn> </msqrt> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> <mo>]</mo></mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4646@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Give a geometric description for what happens to any vector in the <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaamyEaaaa@3AF7@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-plane under the linear transformation <math> <semantics> <mi>M</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGnbaaaa@39CE@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
